original_title: FLOSS Weekly Episode 797: Coreutils — Don’t rm -r Up the Tree
original_content:
This week Jonathan Bennett and Dan Lynch chat with Pádraig Brady about Coreutils! Its been around since the 90s, and is still a healthy project under active development. Youve almost certainly used these tools whether you realize it or not! Whats the relationship with the other coreutils implementations? And why is GNU Coreutils the most cautious of them all?


https://www.pixelbeat.org/contact.html
http://www.pixelbeat.org/docs/coreutils-testing.html
http://www.pixelbeat.org/docs/coreutils-gotchas.html
http://www.pixelbeat.org/programming/avoiding_large_buffers.html
https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/rejected_requests.html
https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/quotes.html
http://www.pixelbeat.org/docs/coreutils_i18n/


Did you know you can watch the live recording of the show Right on our YouTube Channel? Have someone youd like us to interview? Let us know, or contact the guest and have them contact us! Take a look at the schedule here.

Direct Download in DRM-free MP3.
If youd rather read along, heres the transcript for this weeks episode.

title: GNU Coreutils: 長寿プロジェクトの魅力
body: 90年代からあるCoreutilsについて話し合われた。GNU Coreutilsは他の実装より慎重で、積極的に開発中。Coreutilsを使っているのに気づかないこともあるかも。関連リンクも掲載。
titles: GNU Coreutils: 長寿プロジェクトの魅力
Coreutils: 90年代から進化を続ける
Coreutils: GNU版が最も慎重な理由
Coreutilsと他の実装の関係性を探る
Coreutilsのバグ回避テクニック
